meanings.definition: A loud, excited noise or commotion.
meanings.sent1: The children's whoopla could be heard from across the playground.
meanings.sent2: There was a whoopla of cheers when the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent3: The whoopla of the party made the neighbors curious.
meanings.sent4: The whoopla of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The whoopla of the parade filled the streets with joy.

meanings.sent1: She caused a whoopla by accidentally knocking over the display.
meanings.sent2: There was a whoopla at the meeting when the controversial topic was brought up.
meanings.sent3: The whoopla over the missing cake was quickly resolved.
meanings.sent4: The whoopla in the classroom quieted down as the teacher entered.
meanings.sent5: The whoopla in the restaurant drew everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: The circus performance was a grand whoopla of colors and acrobatics.
meanings.sent2: The wedding reception was a beautiful whoopla of decorations and music.
meanings.sent3: The whoopla of the fashion show dazzled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The whoopla of the holiday lights brightened up the street.
meanings.sent5: The whoopla of the magician's tricks amazed the crowd.
